Summary of Request: Records pertaining to the Americans with Disabilities Act
Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the Civil Rights Division, DOJ, was the most appropriate entity for handling, and referred request and requester to that component for processing and directed requester to FOIA.gov for the contact information of additional federal agencies that might maintain records on this subject

Summary of Request: Records on a third party
Disposition of Request: Other: Documents referred by office originally processing the request were determined to be not responsive to the request after review by OIP

Summary of Request: Copies of the 1866 and 1871 Civil Rights Acts; the Privacy Act of 1974; the Freedom of Information Act; and the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
Disposition of Request: Full Grant: Provided requester with copies of publicly available material

Summary of Request: Seeking assistance in obtaining a copy of a discovery package from a local Pennsylvania court case
Disposition of Request: Other: Informed requester that the FOIA does not apply to state or local records and provided contact information for the Pennsylvania Attorney General's Office

Summary of Request: Information regarding wiretap authorizations
Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the FBI and the Executive Office for United States Attorneys, DOJ, were the most appropriate entities for handling, and referred requester to those components for processing

Summary of Request: Records from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, United States Citizenship and Immigration Service, and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement regarding third parties
Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the Federal Bureau of Prisons, DOJ, USCIS and ICE, DHS, were the most appropriate entities for handling, and referred requester to those offices for processing

Summary of Request: Employment records for two named U.S. Magistrate Judges, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, various records from a federal and a state court cases, proof of jurisdiction for federal officials, and employment forms for a number of unnamed federal officials
Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the  Executive Office for United States Attorneys, DOJ, was the most appropriate entity for handling, and referred requester to that component for processing; Provided requester with contact information for the state of Texas for local court records; Informed requester that DOJ does not maintain records on magistrate judges and that although the FOIA does not pertain to the judicial branch, the request could be directed to the Administrative Office of the United States Courts

Summary of Request: Communications from Attorney General Holder relating to April 9, 2012 Project Veritas video
Disposition of Request: Partial Grant/Partial Denial
Description of Exemption(s) (if applicab: Information the release of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of the personal privacy of a third party

Summary of Request: Information pertaining to the appointment of United States Attorney Rachel Paulouse (District of Minnesota)
Disposition of Request: Other: Documents referred by office originally processing the request were determined to be not responsive to the request after review by OIP

Summary of Request: Information pertaining to a third party
Disposition of Request: Full Grant

Summary of Request: Indictment and grand jury sheet filed in U.S. v. Thompson
Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the Executive Office for United States Attorneys, DOJ, was the most appropriate entity for handling and referred requester to that component for processing

Disposition of Request: Other: Determined that the  Executive Office for United States Attorneys, DOJ, was the most appropriate entity for handling, and referred requester to that component for processing; Provided requester with contact information for the state of Texas for local court records; Informed requester that DOJ does not maintain records on magistrate judges and that although the FOIA does not pertain to the judicial branch, the request could be directed to the Administrative Office of the United States Courts
